required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Ostenil® Plus in the Treatment of Coxarthrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Ostenil® Plus in the Treatment of Coxarthrosis

brief_summary.textblock: PMCF study to observe the Routine application of Ostenil® Plus in the Treatment of pain and restricted mobility in degenerative and traumatic changes of the Hip Joint.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Pain Intensity compared to Baseline (VAS-slider)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7, Day 14, Day 84 after last injection, Day 168 after last injection
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of Pain Intensity by the Patient on a 10 cm VAS-slider (10 cm equals the most pain)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Range of Motion compared to Baseline (Goniometer measurement)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7, Day 14, Day 84 after last injection, Day 168 after last injection
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of the Range of internal and exernal rotation of the Hip Joint using a Goniometer.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Subjective Symptom Evaluation (Overall Impression on a scale from 1 to 5)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7, Day 14, Day 84 after last injection, Day 168 after last injection
primary_outcome.description: The Change of Overall Subjective Symptom Evaluation on a scale from 1 (much improved) to 5 (much worse).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 252 after the last injection

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Subjective Therapy Evaluation of Pain (HOOS Questionnaire) compared to Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 84 after last injection, Day 168 after last injection
primary_outcome.description: Hip Disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (HOOS) to assess Pain on a 5-point Likert scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Subjective Therapy Evaluation of Stiffness (HOOS Questionnaire) compared to Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 84 after last injection, Day 168 after last injection
primary_outcome.description: Hip Disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (HOOS) to assess Stiffness on a 5-point Likert scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Subjective Therapy Evaluation of Function in daily living (HOOS Questionnaire) compared to Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 84 after last injection, Day 168 after last injection
primary_outcome.description: Hip Disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (HOOS) to assess Function in daily living on a 5-point Likert scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Subjective Therapy Evaluation of Quality of Life (HOOS Questionnaire) compared to Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 84 after last injection, Day 168 after last injection
primary_outcome.description: Hip Disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (HOOS) to assess Quality of Life on a 5-point Likert scale

arm_group.description: 1-3 injections of sodium hyaluronate 2% (40 milligrams (mg) / 2,0 millilitres (ml)) in weekly interval.

intervention.description: Ostenil® Plus is a CE-certified viscoelastic solution for injection into the Joint cavity, containing 2.0 % Sodium hyaluronate from fermentation

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with Coxarthrosis and a Recommendation for Treatment with Ostenil® Plus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects ≥ 18 years of age and in good general health condition
2. Signed informed consent
3. Existing Ostenil® Plus recommendation for the treatment of coxarthrosis
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known hypersensitivity to one of the OSTENIL® PLUS components
2. Known pregnancy or lactating females
3. Previous/concomitant participation in clinical investigation within the last 3 months prior to study inclusion
4. Subjects not capable of contracting and of understanding the nature, risks, significance and implications of the clinical investigation and unable to form a rational intention in the light of these facts
5. Subjects unable to understand informed consent or having a high probability of non compliance to the study procedures and / or non completion of the study according to investigator's judgement (e.g. illiteracy, insufficient knowledge of local language)
